instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..

threads.title: 2018/2019 MacBook Pro 13" screen in 2016/2017?
threads.message: Has anyone tried this? Even thought the pinout is different I have a feeling it would work. Trying to avoid blowing anything up though.

threads.title: 2018/2019 MacBook Pro 13" screen in 2016/2017?
threads.message:
Few threads already about this on the forum; even recent one...

[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-display-compatibility.59885/#post-64081[/URL]

threads.title: 2018/2019 MacBook Pro 13" screen in 2016/2017?
threads.message: Thanks, no conclusion with those threads so I'll probably have to just wing it and see what happens. I don't think anything will blow up so it should be fine.

threads.title: 2018/2019 MacBook Pro 13" screen in 2016/2017?
threads.message: I installed a 2017 screen into a 2018...picture was there but no camera.

threads.title: 2018/2019 MacBook Pro 13" screen in 2016/2017?
threads.message: Ah, the camera, bummer. Thanks for the info. I'm guessing going the other way would probably end up with similar issues.
